Job description

David Jones wants to inspire people by providing an exceptional experience. As one of the leading international retailers, we've done this by curating the world's leading brands across fashion, beauty, home and food. By enabling and empowering our employees, David Jones ensures that we are a destination for endless possibilities.



Our Food team is committed to connecting and inspiring our customers who love food by delivering the best range of branded and private label products across David Jones. Our Buying team is responsible for establishing our trading strategy by aligning ourselves with our customer’s needs, partnering with our suppliers to maximise on potential and implementing sustainable sourcing practices as part of our Good Business Journey.


We are opening our doors for an experienced Food Buyer to build our Long Life category as part of David Jones growth in Food. You will be a passionate foodie with strong commercial acumen, analytical capabilities and partner with our local suppliers and international vendors to make David Jones the number one destination for gourmet grocery.


In this role you will:


  • Achieve sales and profit targets
  • Develop appropriate product ranges by store profile to align to our strategy, customer expectations and profile.
  • Manage margins, waste and markdowns within agreed target ranges
  • Ensure effective management of stock to satisfy customer demand
  • Identify emerging food trends in your area of expertise and producers within the market
  • Maintain effective relationships with suppliers, working to develop new ranges and products in line with identified business opportunities and trends
  • Work with store teams and suppliers to ensure compliance to regulatory guidelines
  • Manage supplier performance standards
  • Ensure competitive pricing and delivery of an effective value proposition to customers.
  • Develop good working relationships and work in partnership with other team members including Food Technologists and Product Developers.

\xa0


We are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you:


  • Have significant experience in buying, or similar commercial exposure with a proven track record
  • Experience in Food buying would be advantageous
  • Have a relevant tertiary qualification
  • Possess strong numerical and analytical skills
  • Possess strong retail and commercial acumen
  • Have the ability to work alongside a range of key senior stakeholders in order to achieve business outcomes
  • Have the ability to meet deadlines and work within a fast paced environment whilst balancing competing interest’s
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation
  • Have a passion for food

\xa0


At David Jones we go the extra mile. We offer;


  • Opportunities to work with premium Foods, Fashion, Beauty and Home products
  • David Jones employee discounts & a highly competitive incentive scheme
  • An opportunity to work with a trusted iconic brand
  • Be part of building an iconic David Jones foods business
  • Ongoing training and development in order to pursue excellence

\xa0


To begin a career with endless possibilities, we invite you to begin your application now.

Desired Skills and Experience

We are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you:


  • Have significant experience in buying, or similar commercial exposure with a proven track record
  • Experience in Food buying would be advantageous
  • Have a relevant tertiary qualification
  • Possess strong numerical and analytical skills
  • Possess strong retail and commercial acumen

  • Have the ability to meet deadlines and work within a fast paced environment whilst balancing competing interest’s

How you fit


At iSelect, we get that most people find insurance, utilities and personal finance boring. But we understand that it's really important to 'always get it right'. As Australia's 'Life Admin Store', we'll help you take care of the boring but important stuff. \xa0We provide Australians with the convenience of an online comparison and the benefit of telephone-based advice and sales across many product areas.

  • A free coffee each day, a funky caf\xe9 and work space
  • A generous Reward & Recognition Program and many other Employee Benefits!

854220233:
[

Full Stack Engineer

Company Name AirTree Ventures Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 35 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Take a seat on the Xplor rocketship and join us on our mission to change education around the world. We're a rapidly growing startup and are looking for a Full Stack Developer to help us build amazing technology.


What does Xplor do?

We're a software (SaaS) company based in Melbourne that has revolutionised the day to day operations of childcare centres across the world. By automating administration we make it possible for educators and parents to focus on a child's education.

Our Product and Development teams are where we dream up what's next for Xplor, and where we do everything necessary to make it happen.


What will I be doing as a Full Stack Developer?

Our Full Stack Developers are a part of the team that create the product that allows education services to automate administration, streamline their financials and reporting, and digitise attendance and bookings. As a Full Stack Developer, you will get to:


  • Work with the dedicated Office team to ensure projects are delivered on time, and to best practice & quality guidelines
  • Participate in the design, development and maintenance of applications and web services for use in the Xplor platform
  • Participate the entire application lifecycle right from concept to delivery as well as post launch support
  • Heavily involved in design, testing and code review
  • Regular exposure to business stakeholders and executive management, as well as the authority and scope to apply expertise to many interesting technical problems
  • Be a part of a team with a shared goal - disrupting a market through technology and improving lives of families across the country
  • Experience with programming applications and web services using languages such as Elixir, Ruby, PHP and Javascript as well as JSON, HTML5 and CSS
  • Elixir experience is not required, but a genuine interest in learning the language is a must!
  • React experience is also not required, but it would be helpful if you have used it before
  • Experience writing and managing test suite, code management and CI, and excellent debugging and optimisation skills
  • Able to take a proactive, hands on, and collaborative approach in all sprints and tasks
  • You are a proactive and self-motivated person with a strong drive to achieve personal goals
  • You are able to show awareness of your own strengths and areas for growth, with a desire to develop and apply new skills
  • Motivated by a fast paced, high pressure environment where you will have to constantly adapt - no two days are the same, seriously
  • Our core values hit home for you: Be Humble, Obsess Over Customers, Think Deeply Move Quickly, and Embrace Change
  • If you can find Bobby Tables on our website, extra points :)


What would make me a good candidate?

What is it like to work at Xplor?

You'll be a part of a thriving startup funded by top investors including Airtree Ventures. But more importantly, you will get to be part of a team with big dreams and a shared goal to make a real impact on the education sector. Some of the other perks of working with us:


  • Unparalleled opportunities to learn with swift progression for high performers
  • A great team environment where we support, recognise, and care about each other
  • A funky, open plan office located on Bourke Street (check out our Instagram for a behind the scenes look!)
  • Regular team activities like Burger Fridays, social drinks, mini golf, movie night, and more
  • Plenty of rocket-related puns, of course!

Sheryl Sandberg once said, "If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on." We couldn't agree more. So, are you ready to get on board? To apply, please submit your CV and a brief covering letter through the application link and we will be in touch as soon as we can.


Individuals seeking employment at Xplor are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

856660215:
[

Senior Architect - Enterprise

Company Name Orica Company Location Victoria Parade - Office (00538)

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Orica is the world’s largest provider of commercial explosives and innovative blasting systems to the mining, quarrying, oil and gas and construction markets, a leading supplier of sodium cyanide for gold extraction, and a specialist provider of ground support services in mining and tunnelling. Orica has a diverse workforce of around 11,500 employees and contractors, servicing customers across more than 100 countries. Our purpose is to make our customers successful, every day, all around the world. We take pride in operating safely, responsibly and sustainably. Together, these enable us to grow and create enduring value for our shareholders.

\xa0

About the role

\xa0

Reporting through to the Head of IT Strategy & Governance, this role is responsible for the creation, iteration and maintenance of business application, data & information governance at Orica. This pivotal role will design robust frameworks, data architectures, standards and processes to support a future state business applications & data architecture that underpins the enterprise architecture to enable business growth and technology optimisation.

This role is expected to develop, communicate, enforce, and maintain the overall business application & data architecture systems, standards, processes & frameworks. Orica’s ideal candidate will have a broad knowledge of Enterprise applications information management, master data processes & automation, BI & analytical data modelling concepts and integration architectures.

\xa0

What you will be doing

\xa0

  • Collaborating with the Head of IT Strategy & Governance to define business application & data & information architecture standards, processes, principles and tools to support these domains;
  • Undertake detailed analysis of the information management requirements across all systems, platforms and applications to guide the development of information management standards in line with the enterprise architectural strategies;
  • Define, develop and communicate the data classification standards to promote consistent and optimal data management practices and incorporate them into information-based developments;
  • Ensuring alignment of business and application architectures to Enterprise Architecture standards, principles, frameworks and processes;
  • Defining a systematic approach to data cleansing, conversion and migration resulting in accurate, high-quality data that can be used throughout the organisation;
  • Designing, establishing and enforcing robust data & information governance policies, standards and procedures to document and enforce data & information management standards;
  • Conducting regular audits on data quality, analyse potential risks and/or variances and drive improvements to optimise master data management processes;
  • Proactively appraise and modify current application architectures to identify deficiencies, research alternatives and determine improvements;
  • Contributing to the High-Level Business Process Design, Blueprint Workshop Approach, Blueprint Workshops, Business Process Designs and RICEFW Functional Design Specifications;
  • Analyse business requirements to gain a detailed understanding of business, IT and user expectations and the required characteristics of Orica’s applications (including functionality, availability and performance)

\xa0

Desired Skills and Experience

What you bring

  • Graduate/postgraduate qualifications combined with a strong IT business background in accounting, engineering, or similar disciplines;
  • Ability to lead and communicate effectively with the Business, IT and designers in the definition of the overall solution;
  • Minimum 5 years SAP or similar ERP experience across a broad range of modules including responsibility for integration across the modules;
  • Excellent facilitation skills and expertise in process flow mapping, blueprint and documentation coupled with problem solving and relationship management skills;
  • Deep knowledge of the selected packaged application architecture components;
  • Strong application architecture and solution design knowledge with understanding of technical architecture concepts.
  • Minimum 5 years data & information management and governance experience across the Information management domain \xa0

\xa0

What we offer

\xa0

\xa0

  • The opportunities, facilities and environment associated with working in an international organisation;
  • Career paths that are totally flexible allowing you to specialise or become a generalist;
  • A\xa0diverse workplace where your unique abilities and talents will be recognised and encouraged;
  • Training programs, opportunities and initiatives to ensure your continued growth;
  • Competitive salary packages.\xa0

Contact the job poster

  • Oil & Energy

Relationship Manager - Major Gifts

Company Name Talent Nation Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Relationship Manager – Major Gifts\xa0

Melbourne\xa0

\xa0

The company\xa0

The World Wildlife Foundation (WWF) is one of the most recognised and respected brands globally. As an independent conservation organisation it has biodiversity and environmental protection at its heart. Their Australian efforts focus on the environmental issues that are most impactful on Australia’s natural resources, ensuring that they are managed to promote long term ecological sustainability. They are working to build a future in which humans live in harmony with nature and are widely applauded for their ability to generate positive relationships in the promotion of environmental preservation. \xa0

\xa0

The role\xa0

As the Relationship Manager, you will oversee a portfolio of WWF-Australia’s most high-profile and generous friends and supporters. As a part of the Philanthropy team, you will be responsible for strengthening WWF’s ability to achieve its strategic objectives through the generation and growth of sustainable major gift support.


Key responsibilities will be to:

  • Working closely with the conservation team to develop bespoke case studies to present to prospective donors
  • \xa0Develop and manage strong relationships with key supporters, prospects, and internal stakeholders \xa0
  • Undertake research and analysis to better understand the environmental conservation philanthropic landscape \xa0
  • Deliver on targets to generate and grow strong, long-term sustainable income

\xa0

About you\xa0

With a passion for environmental conservation and sustainable development, you will have experience in fundraising/marketing strategy. \xa0


Ideally you will possess: \xa0

  • Demonstrated experience in relationship management
  • Demonstrated ability in writing and presenting engaging proposals to groups \xa0
  • A track record of delivering against revenue targets
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to present, influence and negotiate at a range of levels \xa0

\xa0

The rewards\xa0

This is an opportunity to connect people who have an altruistic desire to improve the state of the planet, by working with one of the world’s most recognisable brands. You will form relationships with high profile stakeholders who are proud to leverage their wealth and influence to fund WWF’s conservation and sustainable development work. Through relationship management, you will empower philanthropists to make real and lasting contributions in protecting the natural environment and helping support the communities that share them.

\xa0

If you have the capability and drive to take on this transformative role then we encourage you to contact Kate Faulkner on 03 9600 0115 or send your CV to Apply@talentnation.com.au quoting "Relationship Manager".\xa0

855879027:
[

Senior Software Engineer

Company Name Ippon Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 54 minutes ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

From humble beginnings in 2003, Ippon Technologies has built a reputation as a global boutique consultancy in the delivery of business oriented technology value. Our people work with household name consumer brands across multiple industry sectors to provide better customer experiences and deeper business value.


We’re a team of true technologists who leverage contemporary thinking and tools to enhance the way our clients drive value. Wether it’s a bespoke platform to improve employee engagement within a national retail chain, or developing an app that provides next level direct customer interaction; value is delivered to our clients when we begin by understanding the business outcomes they desire and then apply our technical expertise to make these a reality.


Our team in Australia is growing in line with our customer demand, and we’re adding new technologists to our team. We’re heavily invested in AWS and come from a rich Java pedigree. If you’re a Software engineer who enjoys the challenge of designing and delivering bespoke solutions to complex problems then you’ll love working with our cross functional teams on site with clients. You’ll work all the way from discovery to delivery and beyond to solve problems that are at the heart of some of our customers most burning issues.


As well as your Bachelors Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) you’ll ideally come fully armed with experience across the contemporary business technology landscape, such as:


  • Enterprise Level Java up to 8.0, 9.0 if you’re a real smarty pants
  • Cloud experience especially with AWS
  • Microservice based architectures
  • Version Control experience with Git or similar
  • DevOps, Continuous Integration and build automation
  • Modern front end frameworks such as React (we also like React Native!)


Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and serverless technologies are also really well regarded. Most importantly though, we expect you to be a curious technologist who seeks to first understand the problem and look to collaboratively find solutions.


You’ll find the work challenging, the people stimulating and the environment friendly, welcoming and accepting. We’re a team of committed technologists here to do our best work, we’re quick to trust, easy to get along with and curators of elegant solutions.


You’ll get a shiny new Mac, a training allowance, options to salary sacrifice and generous leave entitlements. Oh and don’t forget the Thursday team lunches where we all get together and share the joy.


If you’ve gotten this far and are thinking, “Complex bespoke solutions are my thing, I’d love to do that” then please apply. If you’ve gotten this far and thought, “My mate Jenny would love this!”, then please let her know.


You do need to have work rights in Australia to be considered for this role.\xa0

\xa0
